content.text: hey can you read this file and tell me what it says?

messages.content:
The file you've shared is a README.md file that contains just a simple header:

**# Claude-Interface**

That's all the content in the file - it appears to be just the title/name of a project called "Claude-Interface" formatted as a markdown header. The file seems to be quite minimal and doesn't contain any additional description, instructions, or other information yet.
can you send me a message contaitng a bunch of formatting like lists tables headers etc so i can test my markdown formatter

# Markdown Formatting Test Document

## Headers
### This is an H3
#### This is an H4
##### This is an H5
###### This is an H6

## Text Formatting
**Bold text** and *italic text* and ***bold italic text***

~~Strikethrough text~~

`Inline code` and regular text

## Lists

### Unordered List
- First item
- Second item
  - Nested item
  - Another nested item
    - Deeply nested item
- Third item

### Ordered List
1. First ordered item
2. Second ordered item
   1. Nested ordered item
   2. Another nested ordered item
3. Third ordered item

### Task List
- [x] Completed task
- [ ] Incomplete task
- [x] Another completed task

## Tables

| Name | Age | City |
|------|-----|------|
| Alice | 30 | New York |
| Bob | 25 | Los Angeles |
| Charlie | 35 | Chicago |

## Code Blocks

```python
def hello_world():
    print("Hello, World!")
    return True
```

```javascript
function greet(name) {
    console.log(`Hello, ${name}!`);
}
```

## Blockquotes

> This is a blockquote
> 
> It can span multiple lines
> 
> > And can be nested
> > 
> > Like this

## Links and Images

[This is a link](https://example.com)

![Alt text for image](https://example.com/image.png)

## Horizontal Rule

---

## Mixed Content

Here's a paragraph with **bold**, *italic*, and `code` mixed together. You can also have [links](https://example.com) in paragraphs.

### Code with syntax highlighting

```bash
#!/bin/bash
echo "Testing bash syntax highlighting"
ls -la
```

### Complex Table

| Feature | Supported | Notes |
|---------|-----------|-------|
| Headers | ✅ | All levels |
| **Bold** | ✅ | Works in tables |
| `Code` | ✅ | Inline code too |
| Links | [✅](https://example.com) | Clickable |

---

*This should give you plenty of different markdown elements to test with!*
